Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

The JPL Communications, Tracking, and Radar Division performs scientific investigations, advanced technology research, engineering developments, and system implementations encompassing space telecommunications, tracking and active remote sensing using electromagnetic waves.

The Flight Communications Systems Section (337) develops, delivers, and supports Software Defined Radios (SDRs), spacecraft and airborne antennas, RF power amplifiers, and related products for RF system applications including radars, radio science instruments, and GPS tracking sensors.

JPL’s Flight Communications Systems Section is looking for a Power Electronics Design Engineer III to join their Spacecraft Transmitter Systems Group. As a member of this group, you will report to the Group Supervisor within the Flight Communications Systems Section.

Responsibilities

  • Designing switching DC-DC power converters of various topologies (e.g. buck, boost)

  • Designing PCBs and cabling carrying high voltages (1 kV to 30 kV)

  • Overseeing packaging and assembly of high voltage electronics, including potting of high voltage magnetics

  • Interfacing with industry manufacturers to support design, build, and test of high voltage magnetics

  • Electronic device evaluation and characterization

  • Detailed circuit analysis using Spice tools

  • Designing test and support equipment

  • Generating (or reviewing) worst case analyses, parts selection and parts stress analysis, manufacturing documentation, and test procedures

  • Preparing and presenting material at design reviews

  • Designing electronics subsystems, system architectures, and developing requirements and specifications

  • Preparing test methods and specifications; analyzing equipment to establish operating data and conducting experimental tests; providing final equipment approval, and preparing documentation and user information

  • Researching, developing, designing, and testing electronic components, equipment, technology, systems, and networks

  • Specifying, designing, and testing for compatibility with applicable electromagnetic environments

  • Applying a wide-ranging experience and advanced knowledge in the field to derive and document assembly level engineering requirements, specifications, and interface definitions

  • Partnering with other engineers, project personnel, and management to design and develop highly complex and critical electronics system architectures

  • Leading the development of highly complex and critical digital and/or analog circuit boards and assemblies

  • Applying extensive and wide-ranging application experience to prepare significant requirements documents, interface agreements, verification and validation (V&V) plans, risk mitigation plans, and execute V&V plan

  • Leading subsystem and system level test and verification teams

 
Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, or related technical discipline with a minimum of 6 years of related experience, a Master’s degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 4 years of related experience, or a Ph.D. in similar disciplines with a minimum of 2 years related experience.

  • Extensive experience in power and analog circuit design for space flight missions.

  • Extensive experience in space flight hardware design with the ability design and solve technical problems in the area of power and analog circuit design.

  • Extensive experience in the development of spaceflight hardware including the documentation and evaluation involved in delivering space flight electronic hardware; the ability to perform worst-case analysis, parts stress analysis and single event transient analysis on this hardware.

  • Advanced knowledge and experiencee in power supply systems development and design engineering.

 Desired Skills

  • Extensive experience leading spacecraft electronic hardware development projects and managing contracts for spacecraft hardware.

  • Experience with design of high voltage DC-DC power converters

  • Computer and analytical skills necessary for power and analog circuit design (Spice tools)

  • Have experience with printed circuit board programs (OrCAD, Altium Designer), and experience with taking circuit designs through analysis, design, build, and test.

  • Good communication skills.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more.
